job.title: Software Engineer - Front-end (Premium)
job.description: linkedin was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers and every day millions of people use our products to make connections discover opportunities and gain insights our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the worlds workforce in ways no other company can we are much more than a digital resume we transform lives through innovative products and technologyltbrgtltbrgtcreating economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce is a responsibility we all share to truly transform the global economy we must evolve the way we hire and enable our talent to serve people of all backgrounds and experiences linkedin is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employerltbrgtltbrgtthe premium platforms team builds products and technology that power linkedins online subscriptions businesses as a software engineer you will be responsible for building products that empower linkedin to deliver economic outcome to members you will directly impact millions of members through your work while also supporting a large online businessltbrgtltbrgtresponsibilitiesltbrgt you will own the frontend development for one or more of our products and collaborate with visualinteraction designers other engineers and product managers to launch new products iterate on existing features and build a worldclass user experienceltbrgt you will implement cuttingedge technologies and will be writing stateoftheart code to keep linkedin at the cutting edge of current technologyltbrgt your specific expertise will be required to make the site delightful secure performant and accessible to all our membersltbrgt you will meet with colleagues including product managers designers and other engineers assigned to your projectsltbrgtltbrgtbasic qualificationsltbrgt bs in computer science or related technical field involving coding eg physics or mathematics or equivalent technical experienceltbrgt years of industry experienceltbrgtltbrgtpreferred qualificationsltbrgt years of relevant work experienceltbrgt ms or phd in computer science or related technical disciplineltbrgt experience writing clean javascript including experience with modern frameworks angularemberreact and debugging tools chrome dev tools etcltbrgt expertlevel knowledge of emberltbrgt knowledge of and a passion for current trends and best practices in frontend architecture including performance accessibility security and usabilityltbrgt experience building largescale consumerfacing productsltbrgtltbrgtyou will benefit from our cultureltbrgtwe strongly believe in the wellbeing of our employees and their families that is why we offer generous health and wellness programs and time away for employees of all levelsltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtltbrgtequal opportunity statementltbrgtlinkedin is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer linkedin considers qualified applicants without regard to race color religion creed gender national origin age disability veteran status marital status pregnancy sex gender expression or identity sexual orientation citizenship or any other legally protected class linkedin is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer as described in our equal opportunity statement here httpslnkdinequalemploymentopportunity please reference httpwwweeocgovemployersuploadeeocselfprintposterpdf and httpswwwdolgovofccpregscomplianceposterspdfofccpeeosupplementfinaljrfqacpdf for more informationltbrgtltbrgtlinkedin is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers including individuals with disabilities our goal is to foster an inclusive and accessible workplace where everyone has the opportunity to be successful ltbrgt ltbrgtif you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening apply for a position or participate in the interview process connect with us at accommodationslinkedincom and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disabilityrelated limitation ltbrgt ltbrgtreasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to ltbrgt ltbrgtdocuments in alternate formats or read aloud to you ltbrgthaving interviews in an accessible locationltbrgtbeing accompanied by a service dogltbrgthaving a sign language interpreter present for the interviewltbrgt ltbrgta request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days however nondisability related requests such as following up on an application will not receive a responseltbrgtltbrgtlinkedin will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about discussed or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant however employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information unless the disclosure is a in response to a formal complaint or charge b in furtherance of an investigation proceeding hearing or action including an investigation conducted by linkedin or c consistent with linkedins legal duty to furnish informationltbrgtltbrgtpay transparency policy statementltbrgtas a federal contractor linkedin follows the pay transparency and nondiscrimination provisions described at this link httpslnkdinpaytransparencyltbrgtltbrgtglobal data privacy notice
